botanical_details.genus: Capsicum are annual or perennial plants, with simple, alternate leaves, and tubular or bell-shaped flowers. They are grown for their glossy, many-seeded edible fruits, including chilli and bell peppers, and as indoor ornamental plants

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a warm glasshouse or sunny windowsill. Water regularly, keeping soil moist but not waterlogged. Do not remove the grafting clip as the plant will shrug this off naturally as it grows. Fruits can be harvested between July and October. See vegetable cultivation and vegetable grafting
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by vegetable grafting, choose a Solanaceae rootstock for sweet and chilli peppers e.g. tomato F1 'Aegis'
how_to_grow.pruning: Pinch out growing tips to encourage bushiness
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, glasshouse whitefly, glasshouse red spider mite
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally disease free, grafted vegetables are more resistant to soil borne diseases
